Description: Sherd of large North Ionian pottery black-figured bowl; inside glazed with incised ornamental friezes separated by bands of added red lined in white; above lotus and bud frieze with added red detail; below tongues; exterior: part of two friezes separated by added red band lined in white; above, goats to right, looking back; below, lotus and bud; added red for details.
Curator's comments: Joined by plaster to 1886,0401.991 & 1088. 1924,1201.964 and 963+967+1031 are from the same bowl. The inside decoration of the whole has a reserved band below the rim and white rosette alternating with triple verticals below; below that incised rosettes ands tongues, lotus and bud and more tongues towards the base. The outside, from the rim down has: short tongues; black-figure animal frieze, lion and bull preserved; stopt meander; goats to left; stop tmeander; goats to right, looking back; lotus-palmettes and buds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1186)
